intro: Pulsatilla slavica, commonly known as the Slavonic pasqueflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many showy and often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its early spring blooming, with showy, cup-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant produces follicles that contain smooth, glossy seeds. Pulsatilla slavica is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
